turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Okay, I'm so tired of my current wardrobe. I need some new clothes, but I'm on a *really* tight budget. Like, under $200 total. Any ideas?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Certainly! To give you the best recommendations, could you tell me what kind of clothing you are looking for (e.g., work attire, casual wear, going-out outfits)? Also, what is your general style preference (e.g., minimalist, bohemian, classic) and what sizes do you wear?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Ugh, so many questions! Okay, fine. I need casual wear, mostly. Think jeans, t-shirts, maybe a sweater or two. I'd say my style is pretty classic, and I wear a size medium in tops and a size 6 in pants.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Got it. I recommend checking out stores like Old Navy, H&M, and Target. They often have sales and affordable basics. You could probably get a pair of jeans for around $30, a few t-shirts for $10 each, and a sweater for $40. That leaves you with some money for accessories! Does that sound helpful?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: That's... okay, I guess. But all that stuff is kinda boring. What if I wanted something a little more unique? Like, is there *any* way to get a cool vintage jacket or something without blowing my whole budget?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Ah, good question! Thrifting and consignment shops are your best bet for unique pieces on a budget. Look for local thrift stores or check out online consignment sites like ThredUp or Poshmark. You might have to hunt, but you can often find designer or vintage items for a fraction of the retail price. Consider setting a price alert for specific brands or items on those sites. Good luck!
